description: T1 Lime (Tilia x europaea): Thin by 10-15% maintaining an even distribution of fine branch structure throughout crown. T3 Lime (Tilia x europaea): Thin by 10-15% maintaining an even distribution of fine branch structure throughout crown. T2 Wych Elm (Ulmus glabra): Remove low epicormic growth, up to 5m. Reduce limbs over road at 5-8m back to previous reduction points, retaining some furnishing growth. Thin remaining crown by 15%, maintaining an even distribution of fine branch structure throughout crown. T4 Hornbeam (Carpinus betulus): Reduce overhang to road by around 2m, back to the curb line. T7 Horse Chestnut (Aesculus hippocastanum) Remove epicormic growth from trunk, up to 5m. Reduce crown to the most recent previous reduction points, removing approx. 1-2m of new growth.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: work in accordance with British Standard
